thread.title: French voters BEG Obama to run in 2017 presidential elections because he is 'FOREIGN'
thread.title_full: French voters BEG Obama to run in 2017 presidential elections because he is 'FOREIGN'

title: French voters BEG Obama to run in 2017 presidential elections because he is 'FOREIGN'
text:
French voters BEG Obama to run in 2017 presidential elections because he is 'FOREIGN' French voters BEG Obama to run in 2017 presidential elections because he is 'FOREIGN' BARACK Obama is facing calls to run in the upcoming French elections because he has the “best resume in the world” and is “foreign”. PUBLISHED: 04:47, Fri, Feb 24, 2017 | UPDATED: 06:07, Fri, Feb 24, 2017 GETTY Obama is facing calls to return to politics, but in France 
Shortly after the former US President declared his time in office as “the honour of his life”, a group of Parisian friends launched a petition dubbed “Obama 17” which aims to collect one million votes before March 15. 
The petition’s website, which urges voters to make a “radical choice”, said: “The French are ready to make radical choices. Which is good because we have radical ideas to propose to them. Related articles Trump backer Ann Coulter insists US only takes in “smart” immigrants 
“Barack Obama has completed his second term as President of the United States on January 21, why not hire him as President for France? 
“At a time when France is about to vote massively for the extreme right, we can still give a lesson of democracy to the planet by electing a French President, a foreigner.” 
Posters publicising the petition have been plastered across Paris, according to reports, and so far 27,000 people have pledged their support. Obama's last tour of Europe in pictures Fri, November 18, 2016 US President Barack Obama on his final trip to Europe as president before handing over power to Donald Trump. Play slideshow 1 of 21 
An Obama17 spokesman told ABC: “We started dreaming about this idea two months before the end of Obama’s presidency. 
“We dreamed about this possibility to vote for someone we really admire, someone who could lead us to project ourselves in a bright future. 
“Then, we thought, whether it’s possible or not, whether or not he is French, we have to do this for real, to give French people hope … Vive la Republique, Vive Obama, Vive la France and the USA.” 
The Obama 17 petition is not the first campaign in which voters have dreamt the impossible and begged Obama to embroil himself in French country’s politics. GETTY Obama 2017 posters plastered across Paris 
Last year, at least two petitions begging for Obama’s leadership were launched, yet Obama 17 has gathered many more signatures. 
The latest polls suggest Marine Le Pen will win the first round of the French elections and predict Emmanuel Macron will win the second round. Related articles
